actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-785, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5466 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments. The amendment recommended by the Committee on Public Works and Transportation shall be considered as original text for the purpose of amendment.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 189.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5466) to amend the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 to enhance competition among air carriers by prohibiting an air carrier who operates a computer reservation system from discriminating against other air carriers participating in the system and among travel agents which subscribe to the system, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 5466 (commercial aviation).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5466) to amend the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 to enhance competition among air carriers by prohibiting an air carrier who operates a computer reservation system from discriminating against other air carriers participating in the system and among travel agents which subscribe to the system, and for other purposes.
